questions.title: Minimum Number of Platforms (Railway/Trading)
questions.prompt: Given arrival and departure times of traders using a terminal, find the minimum number of platforms/seats required so that no trader waits.
followups: Why does sorting both arrays help solve this problem?
What is the time complexity of your approach?
How would the solution change if the times were not sorted?

questions.title: Count Valid Substrings (No Adjacent Repeat)
questions.prompt: Count the number of valid substrings in a given string where no two adjacent characters are the same and the substring length is between `minLen` and `maxLen`.
followups: What is the brute force approach and its complexity?
How does the sliding window maintain the invariant of 'no adjacent repeats'?
How do you handle the length constraints dynamically?

questions.title: Matrix Level Connections (JPMC Specific)
questions.prompt: Given a binary matrix of size m*n. Count the total number of connections possible from a '1' in one row to a '1' in the next feasible row (next row containing at least one '1'). If a row has no '1's, skip to the next row that does.
followups: How do you precompute the count of 1s per row to avoid O(n²) scanning?
What is the edge case where no connections are possible?
Can you solve this in O(m*n) time?

questions.title: Graph Cycle Detection (Add Node/Edge)
questions.prompt: Design a system to manage a graph. Implement `addNode(val)`, `addEdge(node1, node2)`, and `traverse()`. The `addEdge` function must fail if adding the edge creates a cycle.
followups: Why is Union-Find (Disjoint Set) more efficient than DFS for cycle detection in a dynamic graph?
How do you represent the graph for the `traverse()` function?
What is the time complexity of your cycle detection algorithm?

questions.title: Container With Most Water
questions.prompt: Given an integer array `height` of length `n`. Find two lines that together with the x-axis form a container that contains the most water.
followups: Why does the two-pointer approach guarantee correctness?
What is the intuition behind moving the pointer with the smaller height?
What is the time and space complexity?

questions.title: Code Review: ConcurrentHashMap & Synchronization
questions.prompt: (PR Review) You are presented with a Java class that stores account balances in a `HashMap<String, Integer>`. It has `updateBalance(acct, amount)` and `getBalance(acct)` methods. Identify the issues.
followups: Why is `HashMap` not thread-safe?
What specific issues arise with `ConcurrentHashMap`?
How does `ConcurrentHashMap` achieve thread-safety (bucket locking, CAS)?

questions.title: Design a Fraud Detection Model (High Level)
questions.prompt: Design a high-level system to detect fraudulent credit card transactions in real-time.
followups: What are the functional and non-functional requirements?
How do you handle low-latency requirements for approval?
What features (data points) would you use to detect fraud?

questions.title: Design a News Aggregator
questions.prompt: Design a News Aggregator system (like Google News or Bloomberg Terminal feed). Users can log in and set preferences.
followups: How do you fetch articles from multiple sources?
What database schema would you use for user preferences?
How do you handle real-time updates pushing to the UI?

questions.title: Combination Sum II (Recursion)
questions.prompt: Given a collection of candidate numbers (with duplicates) and a target number, find all unique combinations where the candidate numbers sum to target. Each number may only be used once per combination.
followups: How do you avoid duplicate combinations in the result set?
Why is sorting the array necessary?
What is the time complexity of the backtracking approach?

questions.title: Longest Common Prefix
questions.prompt: Write a function to find the longest common prefix string amongst an array of strings (e.g., stock ticker prefixes).
followups: What is the time complexity of the horizontal scanning approach?
How would a Trie optimize this for very large dictionaries?
What edge cases (empty array, identical strings) need testing?

questions.title: Move Zeroes (to end)
questions.prompt: Given an integer array `nums`, move all 0's to the end of it while maintaining the relative order of the non-zero elements. Do it in-place.
followups: Why is a two-pointer approach optimal here?
Can you minimize the total number of write operations?
What if we needed to move zeros to the front instead?

questions.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
questions.prompt: You are given an array `prices` where `prices[i]` is the price of a given stock on the ith day. You want to maximize your profit by choosing a single day to buy one stock and choosing a different future day to sell that stock.
followups: What is the time complexity of the single-pass solution?
How does this relate to Kadane's algorithm?
How would you handle unlimited transactions (Stock II)?

questions.title: Longest Increasing Subsequence (LIS)
questions.prompt: Given an integer array `nums`, return the length of the longest strictly increasing subsequence.
followups: What is the O(n²) DP recurrence?
How does the patience sorting algorithm achieve O(n log n)?
How would you reconstruct the actual subsequence?

questions.title: Coin Change (Minimum Coins)
questions.prompt: Given an array of coin denominations and a target amount, return the fewest number of coins needed to make up that amount.
followups: What is the DP state and transition?
How do you detect if the amount is impossible to form?
What is the space-optimized version of this DP?

questions.title: Java: Singleton Pattern (Thread Safe)
questions.prompt: Write a Singleton class in Java. Explain different ways to make it thread-safe and the pros/cons of each.
followups: What is the difference between Eager and Lazy initialization?
How does the `volatile` keyword help in Double-Checked Locking?
What is the Bill Pugh Singleton (static inner class) approach?

questions.title: Java: Comparable vs Comparator
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between `Comparable` and `Comparator` in Java. When would you use one over the other?
followups: How does `Collections.sort()` work with each?
Can you use both in the same class?
How do you handle null values when sorting?

questions.title: SQL: Find Duplicate Rows
questions.prompt: Given a `transactions` table, write a SQL query to find all duplicate transaction IDs based on the `reference_number` column.
followups: How do you use `GROUP BY` and `HAVING` to achieve this?
How would you delete duplicates while keeping one record?
What index would you create to prevent future duplicates?

questions.title: REST vs SOAP
questions.prompt: What is the difference between REST and SOAP web services? Why is REST more common in modern applications?
followups: What protocol does SOAP typically use?
How does REST leverage HTTP methods?
In what scenario might SOAP still be preferred in banking?

questions.title: Spring Boot: Dependency Injection & Autowiring
questions.prompt: Explain how Dependency Injection works in Spring Boot. What is `@Autowired` and how does it resolve dependencies?
followups: What is the difference between Field, Setter, and Constructor injection?
How does Spring handle circular dependencies?
What is the `@Primary` annotation used for?
